  • Perfect Strangers (1986-1993): This popular sitcom featured Pinchot as Balki Bartokomous, a naive and lovable immigrant from the fictional island of Mypos. The show’s enduring popularity and syndication ensured consistent income for Pinchot for years after its conclusion.
  • The Charm Bracelet (1987): This romantic comedy starring Pinchot as a charming and sophisticated con artist further solidified his position as a comedic leading man.
  • The Wonder Years (1988-1993): Pinchot’s recurring role as the eccentric and lovable Mr. Cutlip, Kevin Arnold’s high school English teacher, brought him a loyal following and further expanded his acting repertoire.
  • The Santa Clause (1994): Pinchot’s role as the quirky and somewhat sinister toy store owner, Neil Miller, in this holiday classic, showcased his versatility and ability to play both comedic and darker characters.
